result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicole R. Thormann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Cocaine (>5-15g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.

miscConds.notes: Bond previously posted of $500.00 applied remaining costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

The defendant shall have no contact with Fredrick Davis  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.

The defendant is to submit to an Alcohol and Other Drug Assessment (AODA) and follow the recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent.

  The defendant shall submit to random urine/PBT testing as required by the agent .

timeConds.notes: Defendant to report on or before 5-1-15 at 7pm. Defendant granted huber privileges to include childcare and may serve the sentence in Dane County if she can make those arrangements.  Privilege of transfer is denied if it results in electronic monitoring. Defendant granted credit for 7 days served.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence out there

superMiscConds.notes: The defendant is to submit to an Alcohol and Other Drug Assessment (AODA) and follow the recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent.

Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.  Financial obligations have been paid except for $28.00, which is payable on a schedule established by the agent.
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  The defendant shall submit to random urine/PBT testing as required by the agent or any law enforcement officer.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

The defendant shall have no contact with Fredrick Davis  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a licensed Wisconsin medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not possess drug pahernalia

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicole R. Thormann
